activities: Informatica collects personal information from its customers, websites, at events hosted or attended by Informatica, from direct marketing campaigns conducted by telephone or email, from other marketing programs, and in the course of human relations activities.
corpofftitle1: Sr. Vice President and General Counsel
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Organization, customer, prospect, and human resources data, including both electronic and manually processed data.
recoursemech: For complaints that cannot be resolved between Informatica and the complainant, Informatica has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the American Arbitration Association (AAA) pursuant to the Safe Harbor principles.  For complaints relating to organization human resouces data that cannot be resolved between Informatica and the complainant, Informatica has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures under the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and/or the Swiss Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
